name: José de Sousa Saramago
about: Portuguese writer and recipient of the 1998 Nobel Prize in Literature. His works, some of which can be seen as allegories, commonly present subversive perspectives on historic events, emphasizing the human factor.(source: wikipedia)

name: Karl Ove Knausgaard
about: Knausgård made his publishing debut in 1998 with the novel Out of the World, for which he was awarded the Norwegian Critics Prize for Literature. (source: wikipedia)

books.title: A Time to Every Purpose Under Heaven

name: Michel Houellebecq
about: Michel Houellebecq, born Michel Thomas, is an award-winning French author, filmmaker, and poet.(source: wikipedia)

name: Louis-Ferdinand Céline
about: French novelist, pamphleteer and physician. He developed a new style of writing that modernized French literature. He remains controversial to this day because of his virulent antisemitism, Holocaust Denial and racism. (source: wikipedia)
